page.title: 12FARMING IN THE WEDMORE AREA
page.content: Nearly all{farmhouses}are made of local stone. Most are over 200 years old and have no central heating. Some have thatched roofs under their tiles. One farmhouse does Bed and Breakfast and one has a caravan site. Three{Vets}operate a modern surgery in Blackford with a 24 hour service. 2/3 of their time is farm work.They most commonly deal with pregnancy problems in cows. Each vet may work as much as 100 hours in a week. Cattle are sent to local{markets,} the most popular being Highbridge. Others used are Bridgwater, Winford, Taunton, Bristol and Glastonbury. The imposition of{milk quotas}by the Common Market in 1984 is unpopular with farmers and is causing economic hardship for some of them.
